question:
You are going to another country to study. You would like to do a part-time job while you are studying, so you want to ask a friend who lives there for some help.
Write a letter to this friend. In your letter
-give details of your study plan
-explain why you want a part-time job
-suggest how your friend could help you find a job
text: I’m writing to you to inform you that I’m moving to your country next year to study for MSc in Data Science at the University of Kingston.

My plan is to complete  my study and live there permanently if I can manage a career opportunity in the meantime. Obviously, I’ll be living with you as it’ll assist me in my study cause you are a BSc Engineer in Computer Science in real life, who is working in this field for a long period of time.

Money issues, my father is sponsoring full-tuition fees, which will be financed from his savings and my mother is paying for the travel fair. Therefore, I only need to manage my living cost from part-time work, which I’m depending on you.
Consequently, I’m asking for a favour from you to manage a part-time job for me to incur my living expenses; otherwise, you can direct me to the process of what I ought to do to find an opportunity.
